newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish pulp exchange has its first trade.
newsitem.headline: Finnish pulp exchange has its first trade.

text.p: Finnish options exchange Suomen Optioporssi (SOP) said in a statement on Tuesday it had recorded its first pulp futures trade on Tuesday at 1242 GMT as 10 June contracts were traded at $550.00.
The contracts correspond to 50,000 tonnes of chemical northern bleached softwood pulp each but they are settled in cash based on SOP's weekly benchmark pulp price PIX.
March futures were untraded and quoted at $544.00/558.00.
